section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.

"Genetic information" means information derived from a genetic test:
about chromosomes, genes, gene products, or inherited characteristics that may derive from an individual or a family member;
not obtained for diagnostic and therapeutic purposes; and
obtained at a time when the individual to whom the information relates is asymptomatic for the disease, disorder, illness, or impairment to which the information relates.

"Genetic information" does not include information:
relating to a disease, disorder, illness, or impairment that is or has been manifested or for which the individual is or has been symptomatic; or
derived from:
"Genetic services" means health services that are provided to obtain, assess, or interpret genetic information or the results of genetic tests.
"Genetic test" means an analysis of human DNA, RNA, chromosomes, proteins, or metabolites that detects genotypes, mutations, or chromosomal changes.

text.section:
Notwithstanding subsection (b)(5) of this section, if the use is based on sound actuarial principles, the results of a genetic test or genetic information may be used to:
deny or limit the amount, extent, or kind of long-term care insurance coverage made available to an individual; or
charge a different rate for the same long-term care insurance.
